values:
Not only will you risk the lives of your passengers and other road users, If you get caught driving under the influence of drugs you could be severely penalised.
If this is your first drug-driving offence your license will be suspended IMMEDIATELY and you will receive a fine up to the value of 12 penalty units and a minimum 12 month cancellation of your learners permit or license.

...There goes the freedom of driving wherever you want! :(

If you are caught drink driving with a full license and you are under 26 years old you will receive a fine, your license will be cancelled, you will be disqualified from driving for a minimum of 6 months and have an alcohol interlock for a minimum of 6 months.

How does waiting for the bus 5 times a day sound?
YUCK!

If you are caught drink driving with a probationary license you will receive a fine, your license will be cancelled, you will be disqualified from driving for a minimum of 3 months and have an alcohol interlock for a minimum of 6 months.

Do you really want to go through that nerve racking driving test again? NO WAY! Don't risk it!

If you are caught drink driving on your learners you will receive a fine, your permit will be cancelled, you will be disqualified from driving for a minimum of 3 months and have an alcohol interlock for a minimum of 6 months.
These are the tamest penalties that could be applied.

... Sooo not worth it mate!

Then no way! Stay away from the driver's seat, buddy.
THC (cannabis) impairs mental functioning and reduces attention and concentration on the driving task. THC can affect driving even when there are no outward signs of impairment.
Methylamphetamine (speed) and MDMA (ecstasy) reduce coordination and affect a person’s ability to adjust speed and distance. It can also increase a person’s confidence so they are more likely to take dangerous risks while driving.

Then maybe think about getting an uber, dude!

Alcohol effects everyone differently and can stay in your system even after you think you have sobered up. 
On average, alcohol is metabolised at 10 ml/hour. This is roughly the size of a standard 285 ml beer or 100 ml glass of wine. On a rough guide, this means that you shouldn’t drive for at least seven hours after enjoying seven glasses of wine.

However, keep in mind that different drinks have different amounts of alcohol content. That’s why it’s important as well to know how many standard drinks you consume each time.

Factors such as weight, gender, height, and liver health can affect how the body processes alcohol.
Awesome! You should be sweet to drive
Ok. If you are sure you're ok, what can i do to help you?
OK. Thats pretty risky, what can I help you with then?
Phew. Glad you're ok, what did you want to chat about then?
Ok. Stay online, contacting 000 now.

Not only will you risk the lives of your passengers and other road users, if you get caught driving under the influence of alcohol you could be SEVERELY penalised. The penalties you could face will depend on the type of license you hold.
What type of driving license/permit do you hold?

There are many types of drugs, and many different unexpected effects. They can cause serious damage to your body, brain, and can even cause you to overdose. You should head over to www.adf.org.au for more information on why you shouldn't try!

I know sometimes it seems like it would be fun, or that all your friends are doing it and you just want to try once but think of the effects it could have on you, your health, your friendships, relationships and family. Is it really worth the risk?
Don't do it!
Definitely not!
You'll regret it tomorrow
No way! You can overdose
Why would you even ask this?
Don't be ridiculous!
Are you Ok? Is your life in danger? Should I call emergency services?

Cigs are no good for you man, Smoking does more harm than any other kind of drug. Even if it's not illiegal and lots of people do it it's still real bad for you, have a look at https://www.quit.org.au/ to try and stop smoking,

Alcohol is a depressant drug. If consumed, alcohol makes you feel more relaxed and you'll have slower reflexes. You could also feel nauseous and could experience memory loss. Alcohol is a legal drug for people over the age of 18.
Well... if you think your friend has an issue with alcohol or drug abuse, it's always good to try and talk to them about it first. But try doing that when they're sober!

Listen... the younger you start drinking, the more inexperienced you'll be at handling alcohol-related problems. Did you know? Almost 2,000 teenagers under the legal drinking age die from alcohol-induced car accidents each year! 2,000!

Hey fam, Cannabis/weed/marijuana is a drug that slows down the messages sent between your brain and body. Consuming cannabis can cause you to feel relaxed and sleepy, increased appetite, blurred vision, bloodshot eyes and anxiety and paranoia.

Depressants are downright depressing. They totally slow you down, make you lose your flow! Depressants include alcohol, cannabis, heroin, etc... Large doses can lead to unconsciousness... or make you vomit! Yuck! Alcohol is also the #1 reason for driving accidents.
Hey man, no need for that language

Heroin is a highly addictive drug that comes from the opium poppy. Consuming heroin could lead to instant pain relief, drowsiness, slow breathing and and irregular heartbeat. Heroin is usually injected into a vein or smoked.

Sorry, buddy. But there's a huge difference between us and adults - they're legal! Most of the time, they are drinking responsibly. I'd like to believe that you're responsible, but I don't feel that alcohol is safe nor healthy for anyone at our age.
goodbye
see you
take care!
seeya
Laters
Bye! Dont do drugs
Stay safe!
Teenage parties often involve underage drinking and drug abuse. If you do go to this party, don't let anyone pressure you into anything you dont want to do.
How can I help you today?
Whats troubling you today?
What would you like to know about drugs and alcohol today?

There are many different types of meth or 'methamphetamine'. Ice is the most common type of meth and can make you feel temporarily extremely confident and lucky. Ice is also  known as 'Crystal' 'Glass' or 'Crank' ...It gives you a quick boost of energy, a temporary high and then cravings and withdrawals all within a short period of time. which ! Ice is highly addictive and can cause dependency from once time use. Ice can also cause severe anxiety, panic attacks, seizures, headaches, stomach cramps, aggression and paranoia... Basically there's nothing good that can come of it and you need to question if its really worth the risk of trying it.
I'm sorry, I didn't understand. Try using a different wording if you can, for example "why shouldn't i do ____" or "Tell me more about ____"

Drugabuse, Arrowhealth, Sharc Inc. Plus many more services can help you with your own drug problems or the problems of others! use the mighty power of Google to look for more local services that may be in your area But if it's an Emergency always call 000, you'll never be in trouble for calling an ambulance
Are you Ok? Is your life in danger? Should I call emergency services?

It's different for every person, buddy! Some drugs can one hit k.o a person, other people can take a few more hits but the effect will be just as deadly! Which drug would you like to know more about? Depressants (Alcohol/Cannabis), Stimulants (Ecstasy/Cocane) or Halluciongens (LSD/MM/Acid)

Good question, buddy! It's tough, but some people are just more vulnerable to addiction than others... anyone, at any age, can become addicted to drugs. But! BUT! Because you're still a growing teen, you are especially vulnerable! Drugs and alcohol set your brain out of whack - they disrupt how you think and act. It only takes a few hits or few pills to start this scary cycle! I know you may think it won’t happen to you, but sometimes you just don’t know!

Yes, Listen carefully... addiction to alcohol and drugs is a process -- not an event.  Most people who drink or do drugs do so with an intention of only using once or “once in a while.”  But mate, you can't decide if you want to become addicted or not! Drinks and drugs just go straight to your brain -- when you let them in, it's no longer you in control, they're the ones in control. Yikes!

I'm serious, drinking too much alcohol or doing drugs can lead to serious problems.... Super serious problems. Problems that will not only affect you, your health and wellbeing but also your friends and family!
Drugs and alcohol can affect your physical and mental health and wellbeing, its so important to look after yourself and make the right choices, not just the ones everyone else is making...

If you're asking that question I don't reckon you would be - but let's check anyway! Have you had any alcohol/illicit drugs in the last 48 hours? If yes, was it alcohol or illicit drugs that you consumed?

Hallucinogens is a big word, and it also has a big effect on your body. Hallucinogens include LSD, magic mushrooms, etc... they can cause you to see or hear things that aren't really there! I promise you I'm really here, though. Large and small doses of hallucinogens can distort your perception of reality. You could easily mistake a dangerous hazard as something safe - be careful of what you grab hold of, buddy!
Great! How are you?
Really good fam. How about you?

dialog_nodes.title: What kind of drugs are there?

values: There are many types of drugs such as marijuana, ice, cocaine, heroin, opium .... etc. All drugs have serious consequences to your health and wellbeing! If you wanna know more go to www.adf.org.au

Stimulants can make you feel wild. Like REALLY wild. Stimulants include caffeine, nicotine, cocaine, ecstasy, etc... it makes your body speedy! Your energy will be at an all-time high! But only for a little while. Large doses of can cause anxiety, panic, seizures, headaches, stomach cramps, aggression and paranoia... basically your nerves are on hyper-drive! You'd basically be sending yourself to the hospital, man.
follow this link for more information on why you shouldn't do drugs! https://adf.org.au/alcohol-drug-use/
Is there anything else I can help you with?
Hello
Hey there
Hey! What would you like to know about drugs and alcohol today?
